title: How do I use an older version?
text: I’ve always had this issue with apps, and anything really. While the newer version might be better on the tech side, the layout functions are annoying. I’d like to go back to my phone oriented design! It was nice to have an image page on my phone optimize space unlike the regular web page does, and while all the website info underneath the images is great and all... sometimes I browse images on google for the images, and I don’t want all that extra! Either way, I reluctantly updated my app recently and now I want to rewind time. I should have gotten away with the old version until it wasn’t compatible.

title: History/Tabs
text: Yesterday I had about thirty tabs open( I know it’s a lot) around 3pm. When I went to check my phone somewhere around 4am half of my tabs had been deleted and the history had reverted back to its previous state. I liked the fact that we could choose when tabs were deleted. 3 months, 1 month, a week, never. But apparently they must’ve released a patch because I no longer have the option to choose when it auto- deletes.I’m not sure if anyone else is having this problem but that’s really my only gripe. Can google please bring back the option to never auto delete the history.

title: Best ever
text: Great resource for info, historical research, and down right fun. Love to Google All the time any chance I get. And so easy to use to find any information. On any subject you could possibly imagine.  Also helps with day to day stuff.  Like recipes and there an billions.  Made so many family favorites with simple step by step cooking instructions. That a lot are family favorites. Some times I admit that all I did was to Google an recipe.  But usually I just play it off like I made it my self.    The best go to by far. Love Google and don’t know what I would do with out it....   such an amazing helpful. User friendly resources.   Love it❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️

title: About the Tabs
text:
This is the best app! I love it. What I didn't love was the previous update to the tabs where it just decided to delete them after 7 days... NOT. OKAY. 
I like my tabs. I like them accessible. I keep them for reasons. I'm so happy the recent update returned to it previous functioning! I no longer have any complaints! It's fast, reliable and easy to navigate. I enjoy the suggested news feed which nearly always sidetracks me when I pull up a new search. I don't like why they know to suggest it... but I have to say I do enjoy many of the articles suggested so... Still the best search engine in my opinion.

title: Google ad’s $500 ad credit is deceptive.
text: I signed up because I saw a promotion that Google ads will credit your account $500 once you spend $500. Hopefully this helps someone else from spending their hard earned money but the promotion is not actually offered. There is fine print that says it’s for new customers only but they don’t mean it as new “advertisers” only.  It’s for new google accounts only. So let’s say you started a Gmail account five years ago but just started advertising last week. Because your email is five years old, they consider that as an old account even though you just started advertising.  It is incredibly deceptive to show this promotion to customers in bold headlines when you sign up, when it is not actually available to you.

title: Dr. Erin Friedman
text:
Dr. Friedman at Progressive Family Care in Waterloo, Illinois,  is a great, attentive, caring doctor during a particularly difficult time.  He has helped me navigate health concerns at all levels.  He is knowledgeable and forthright and cares about all aspects of my well-being.  I was diagnosed with cancer and while I have an oncologist, there have been numerous other extraneous other issues with which he has helped me overcome.  His input and helpfulness has helped
Me to make difficult decisions and to understand the implications of each one.  I could never thank him enough and highly recommend him.

title: Ok but you can live without it
text: Its good for those quick searches and having GOOGLE quite handy but it’s got a lot of flaws. Its pretty unresponsive sometimes and when it is, it’s pretty slow. Viewing longer webpages is a pain because it only scrolls halfway, and some webpages don’t scroll at all. It’s kind of like the same as Google Chrome, but I never had issues with Chrome. It does what you want it to do, this mind has a mind of its own. I think the only thing that’s keeping me from uninstalling this app is that even though I can see my cards on Google Chrome too, the cards on this app looks way better especially if Im just quick checking some headlines, or weather and whatnot. When it comes to responsiveness and fluidity, I dont think it’s programmed on this app.

title: Data Storage
text: I like the Blink system.  The most irritating aspect of the app is that it constantly displays old data (recordings and photos).  For example, this morning there might be multiple photos and motion captures to view.  I look at the recordings and delete them. An hour later, there is a new list of recordings, often from 3-5 days prior.  I view and delete those, and more old recordings pop up.  I’d like to view everything in a timely matter and then delete them so that I know any new recordings are recent.  Very aggravating because I’m constantly being presented with dated recordings that I should have already seen the day they were taken.

title: Don’t change please
text: Google is amazing and this app is great for a quick search. Some people are picky or not technical enough to get around their problem then give lower rating. Just please keep the single search input box, you don’t have to change to be like the new bing, a cluster of stuff on top of each other, trying build every other app functionality within an app. You would want a single input box which Google is doing good job on it and the output can be web results or AI powered but still a single box. Thanks.

title: Unstable, Poor Usability
text:
For some reason I’ve used this app for years and it still locks up or crashes constantly, seemingly on every other minor release and consistently. This is both on iPhone or iPad. Even when it does work as designed, the app design has particularly poor usability and produces high levels of frustration.

For example, It is NOT a real mobile browser nor does it integrate with one (including Chrome!) Therefore, if you find yourself browsing form a search and you accidentally hit the wrong back arrow, it sends you back to the original search and your entire browse history since that search is lost!

Another typical annoyance is how the “Search” and “Google Lens” button are in the same location and interchange depending on the app’s state so you will be accidentally opening your camera 50% of the time.

I give it 2 stars because the search features exceed what you have available using Safari or the IOS search box, but the implementation is so thoughtless that ordinary use is too painful and I regularly remove it from my commonly-used apps out of frustration.

title: STOP CHANGING THE INTERFACE
text: I can’t tell you how many times the app goes from pages to tabs and vice versa. Make up your mind Google! I much prefer the tabs because I have a better view of the sites I have open AND I have the ability to adjust the settings such that the tiles remain open until I choose to delete them. With the pages, this setting doesn’t exist - Instead, GOOGLE decides how long to keep them open. If a page has no activity for 7 days, it’s gone. I had quite a few tabs open in my app that I kept open so I could refer back to it as needed - When I went in today, they were all gone and reverted back to pages. Sure, I can save/bookmark the sites but that’s not my preference. I’m so over it. PLEASE CHOOSE ONE INTERFACE DESIGN (preferably tiles) AND STOP SWITCHING BETWEEN THE TWO. 😠

title: PLEASE FIX BUG!!
text: I love this app but there has been a bug for a month where if I try to search for McDonald’s let’s say and it pulls up a list of the multiple McDonald’s around me and I try to click one on the list to maybe see it’s future hours open or it’s address I get an error saying “Can’t load this page. Check your internet connection and try again” it’s very upsetting because it’s not a connection issue because I can be on WiFi or have full bars of 4glte and this error always pops up... please fix.. I use this app multiple times a day and I don’t want to have to stop using it...

title: Fix swipe gesture
text: Several versions ago, the behavior/gesture to swipe down to dismiss an image found from a search was severely broken. Tapping the back arrow or X buttons is fine, but it’s not the muscle memory I’ve been used to for years. You *can* swap down to dismiss but it’s very difficult to actually make it happen. Also, if you enlarge a hit from an image search, then tap to look at one of the similar/related images below it, and then swipe or tap the X to dismiss, you end up back higher in the original search results having lost your place. The only way to keep your viewing position is to use the back arrow, which of course you have to tap as many times as you went deep on related images.

title: Crashing Crashing Crashing
text: No question this app deserves all the stars there are. But since iOS 13.5, it has been constantly crashing 20 seconds into the app. I can't get it to work even once. This is super frustrating! My brain is tuned to use this app whenever I want to search for something. It's amazing how used to I've become depending on this app, to an extent where my fingers are wired to tap on it every single time I want to search for something (speak of muscle memory 😒). Forgive the ranting. Just fix this app. Please. I do not want to use Safari or even Chrome for any of my searches!

title: Forced device history: no thank you
text:
I do NOT want to have to constantly use incognito mode — which requires Touch/Face ID!! — in order to keep my device history clear. And even incognito isn’t as effectively “clear” as the app used to be: when I reopen Google it’s still on the last page/search I was on when I previously closed it. It’s adding way too much friction and annoyance to the experience, it’s a hassle to maintain my preferred level of privacy, and tbh it’s potentially embarrassing around other people, however silly that might seem.

When I first started using this app it was more convenient, faster, and in tune with my needs than searching via Safari. Those things are no longer true. Struggling to come up with a reason why I should stick with this app if it’s going to keep throwing obstacles in my way.

title: Very informative and interesting
text: At a quick glance or in detail I can read the latest news and happenings in the world I enjoy reading Google everyday.I don’t have to listen to the nonsense/beat it to death of certain President mental outbursts like in the spoken/audible news....here I read it if I want to and delete it if I don’t sometimes you get tired of certain royalties  or certain family that continuously are looking for ways to be on the news and to me they are so boring that it makes you change the channel quickly here you read it or pass it on and away🤣

title: Song search feature not working
text: Okay I like using google just my general searches and stuff. And one thing about this app that I found so interesting was the search for song feature. I thought this specific feature was so neat cause all you had to do was hum a song and it’ll find you the name of that song. But for some reason the feature disappeared and I don’t know why for me. I think I’m only one who has this problem and I’m not sure if it’s because of the device I’m using or something I need to do in my settings. But I tried updating my app and stuff but it still doesn’t work. Anyways, I hope google will see this and help me.

title: Im sure there’s a bug
text: So I keep getting the I’m not a bot page whenever I try to look up something. I’m on a shared network however its only happening to my phone. I looked up Doritos flavors and google says it detects unusual activity on the network. When I looked up how to troubleshoot google insists that their algorithm is just fine. So google tell me what is unusual about Doritos? Or looking up a tv show? FIX THIS ISSUE! It’s obvious that your system is flawed. I’m not the only one this happens to. And before you say it was someone else on the network theres 3 others and two have been asleep when it happened and the other wasn’t using the wifi. Please get this straight I really don’t want to have to find a different search engine. I’ve been using google for years.

title: laggy upon using the search bar widget
text: okay so this is a minor complaint that could be solved easily: when i tap on the search widget, it opens quick but then lags a second or two into typing my search query. this is annoying/ frustrating because sometimes i’ll forget what i meant to type. i have the 12 pro max so RAM or optimization should not be an issue since it runs smooth otherwise. coming from the galaxy side of things where google is baked into the software i don’t have this problem but of course iOS does. sigh! slight bugs but fix them pls i luv u google

title: Recent Pages vs. Original Tabs
text:
Personally, I really liked the old tab format because it was better for me organization-wise. I kept the tabs I needed open and no matter how much I used google, I could always go back to my needed tabs bcos they were stationary.

While I see the benefits of the recent pages new feature instead of the tabs, it doesn’t work for me. As I use google more, my needed ‘pages’ get pushed farther and farther back and I need to scroll more and remember to touch and open every one so theyre back at the front again. It’s super annoying. 

I’d prefer if we could have an option to choose which one we would like to use. Or go back to the old tabs format please :(

title: Same issue as Katiemaxy
text: So, this app is actually fantastic, aside from this: after the most recent update, the iMessage version of the app just sends me to the real thing, which is stupid because my ACTUAL Google App has a time limit on it that keeps it locked down 24/7. I use the app to keep up with news and updates whilst not being able to use the real thing. Google, PLEASE fix this, because this is a very new, very recent bug that I hate with a burning passion. I’m not the only one dealing with this, and this latest update just tonight didn’t fix anything, either.

title: New update is horrible
text: Recently, meaning in the early months of 2019, google released a terrible update. The older way of operating was sooo much easier and this is in categories of searching, history images and more. Previously, when you went to images, if you clicked on a photo the picture would become full screen. Now it is literally identical to Apple’s Safari, as you click on an image and it gives you a few different options like view the webpage etc. Also, you used to have much easier access to your search history, whereas now it tries to be more convenient yet it is really quite pain inducing. Please fix this, as it used to be much easier to use than safari but now it is much more difficult.

title: I liked the old image set-up better....
text:
Overall, the app is pretty good, but I don't like the new way it has images set up, so that GIFs automatically play in their preview image. It's visually distracting to me, especially when browsing through character images. 
I also don't like how you can't zoom in on the images by just tapping on it (like, after you tap it once, and shows you the full image, you used to be able to tap it again, which would hide all the technical information.) Now, tapping on it asks if you want to save it, bookmark it, etc. 
Either go back to the way it used to look, or make it more like the browser view, where GIFs don't automatically play.

title: Avoid, terrible coverage outside cities
text: We subscribed to the family plan and we’re frustrated to find that we had no reception in some of the major National parks like Sequoia national park and the areas around it. When i contacted Google Fi they simply said that it couldn’t be helped. However other members of our group had reception on their phones with Other providers such as AT&T. GoogleFi’s response to this is basically “tough luck” for us, and that there couldn’t be any recompense because the service worked ok in some locations. What’s more is that the support component of the app is so buggy that it makes trying to get any help a terrible and frustrating experience. Overall I recommend that you look for a different  provider and ensure they have better coverage

title: Rude app

title: Big Font
text: I guess with the new update or something it made everything bigger. The search bar, the search results. I used to be able to multiple options for what I had searched for but now I can only see one because of the font size. I ended up deleting the app because it’s no longer easy to look things up. I just use safari  and just barely downloaded google chrome (we shall see how that goes) anyways. I am so sad that I don’t have the google app anymore because it was my go to and was soooo easy to tap and search. But if the font ever goes back to normal size again I will download it again on my phone.

title: Love it but now.....
text: Ive used this app for years on my iPad and love it because it was always signed in.  Now, over the last couple of days, I must log in to access my two email accounts.  If I close the app, I have to sign in again to open, create, or just check my email and I have to do this for each account.  Also have to sign in every time I check my google calendar.  Is there something new I must do to keep it signed in?  Is this a new security feature?  If so, I don’t like it.  Since I use my iPad for business, it’s highly important that I have quick access to my email.  May have to go back to my resident mail app.

title: Works most of the time, but not always
text: Most of the time, the app works wonderfully and I’d much rather use it over Safari. There are times where it freezes or closes down randomly but I’d still recommend it as it occurs very rarely. Also, the app looks nice and I like how it recommends stories to read on the first page according to your searches or what it believes to be your interests but that can lead you to question the amount of privacy you have. Overall, the app is way better than Safari but I question how much privacy  you have and how safe it is. Be careful but that goes for anything on the internet.

title: Trojan Horse, would rate 0 stars if possible
text:
I really didn't want to get this app, but it's been so heavily advertised for its Shazam-like capabilities that I thought it might be worth a try once I found a song even Shazam couldn't identify.

Instead of identifying songs when I ask "what's this song" and then play music, it just gives me a bunch of search results about the feature I'm trying to use, telling me how simple and great it is. If I just play music into the mic without prompting, it won't recognize it as input. You should all reflect on how horrible google Assistant has gotten and realize that it's just a rugpull. You're left with vaporware that insists it has capabilities it abandoned long ago, and they get all of your data to sell to whomever they please. It's so over.

title: Myles
text:
Your newest update or the one right before that added a “From Your History” button at the bottom of the screen which takes away the Home button that was on the bottom of the screen no matter what page you were on.

This is incredibly intrusive and inconvenient.  If I am searching for something and have to go through a few pages, I could have just touched the Homr button to basically end that search and go back to the original Google page and start another search if I wanted to.

Now, I have to keep hitting the back buttons and arrows to return to the Google page.  That could be five or six hits and when the WiFi is spotty take a lot of time or becomes doable

What in god’s name does the From your history button accomplish?  It actually makes things incredibly complicated by bringing up searches from months ago instead of the search one is presently on

Unless there is a way to get rid of this From your history button and bring back the home button (without going in the incognito mode please) I got to stop using this app

title: Best search engine EVER

God bless and may our LORD and savior keep you safe forever and always amen

title: App crashes every time I open it - ONLY when logged in!
text: This used to be one of my favorite apps but now it crashes every single time I open it. It’s been happening for more than 2 months now; I’ve tried every troubleshooting tip I could find but nothing works and I can’t even report the problem because the ONLY way to report an app problem is FROM the app itself but I can’t even open the app. I went into my account settings, revoked access to all devices, deleted and reinstalled the app and when I first initiate the app without being logged in it works perfectly. But as soon as I log in the app crashes. Every single time. My iPhone is up to date, I even tried resetting default iPhone settings and still nothing. How will this ever get addressed if there’s no way for anyone to report it?

title: App constantly crashes
text: I really want to like this app as a Google is much better than Siri. I have this app set up as a widget on my Home Screen so I can quickly press the microphone and ask google a question. But 8 out of 10 times the app will freeze upon pressing the mic button/pressing the search bar and I have to restart the app to get it to work again. This is why it’s 1 star. If this were fixed it would be 4 or 5 stars. I have the latest iPhone 14 pro max and this app has crashed since I have owned the phone in December 2022. Also I would suggest to get rid of tabs. I find it annoying when I search multiple things and it creates a new tab for every search. I would rather the app be used as a one time search type of thing.

title: Window replacement in marysville

It seems that once they get them ordered and installed and there last draw on the payment then your on your own. We will see how this service goes. Very disappointed!

title: Plumbing express

title: Awful customer service

title: Great App But Last Update Broke Things

Not sure how you all tested this before rolling out the update, but this definitely ruins the user experience. I still have 5 stars because i am an app developer myself and i understand some test cases get missed especially when you have a huge machine to develop for. I use this app every morning to get quick news stories, it’s just a bummer to not be able to go to “page two”. Please fix this because it’s really killing vibes. Thanks!

title: Can’t get trending
text: I had the What’s Trending on my phone underneath my Recent Searches. My app was glitching where I couldn’t open the app at all so I deleted it and reinstalled it. That worked for me being able to open the app again, but now I can’t get What’s Trending. I went to the settings and it says that I have What’s Trending on but it’s not showing. My daughter still has the What’s Trending on her phone. I turned my phone on and off and I also turned the enable Trending searches on and off to see if that worked but it didn’t. I really loved this feature and I don’t know why I can’t get it anymore. I can’t get a hold of Google because they don’t have a contact us number anywhere. I went on the google support website and there is nothing saying how to fix this. Please bring this back to my phone.

title: Amazing

Google has helped me with things no one or nothing else can! Even tho it’s other websites everyone has to notice it’s the search engine that makes it possible.. just had a panic attack with my iPhone and apple support was a load of crud I went to google and fixed my problem right away.. after 45 minuets on the phone I could have just went to google.. title: It would be great if we could make it accessible to be able to see the font better
text: It would be really great if it had an accessibility feature or to have a zoom option/feature (like Chrome does) for those of us who are vision impaired. For BOTH the search AND websites we use. Again like Chrome does. It would be such a BIG help for us with vision problems! The text is way too small for us to read, it would benefit a lot if we had the option to enlarge the text on websites and such, since using fingers or VoiceOver to zoom doesn’t help because the pages always revert back to normal, with very small text that makes it extremely difficult to read.

title: Used to be a fan
text:
An example of an app that’s gotten worse over time. Ive used for 3-4 years. Use it because it’s nice to have quick access to search and I find the keyboard better than Safari.

App has changed a lot. Currently it’s a crowded layout and unintuitive tab system. The tabs easily get lost and seem to randomly disappear and reappear. The news articles change too frequently, even sometimes while you’re trying to open one, it’ll disappear and be replaced with another one. And it over-analyzes your history- open one story about Bitcoin and you’ll get 100 Bitcoin articles over the next 6 months.

Overall one star, this app now causes me more confusion and frustration and adds very little value over just using Safari.

title: Great for searching
text: Google will always be the number one search engine for me as it has the best and most accurate results for my searches. I also love the tabs feature however my app seems to go between the tabs as square boxes that I scroll vertically through and them as pages that I scroll vertically through. I didn’t change the setting because I prefer the box view. Also the app has an auto close feature for tabs that you don’t view well I turned mine off because I do periodically go through past searches and prefer to keep them open or save things for later and it still deletes all my tabs! I selected never on the auto close and it still closes my tabs. It is very frustrating

title: Best App Even On iPhone
text:
I have always been a long time fan of the Google app and I recently tried out the keyboard. T
Sorry, GBoard. Hands down awesome. I'm sick of emojis and this finds gifs instead, which is so much better. On top of that, Google gives me notifications on weather, news and feeds I love straight to my phone; always different and always what I want. Chrome, Maps, and Google app is the best setup for your phone, hands down. title: Google Review
text:
Google has continued to innovate and stay up with the times or be a leader in shaping the evolution of not only search but the use of computers. Even after gaining lead many years ago , google didn’t slow down. A scenario not expected but has brought the world to the next level. Amazing. 
Still the best, the adds may get excessive but still in check. Privacy and related issues still being handled readily and professionally. 
Just don’t sacrifice quality and what the company has stood for and continues to stand for.
Thank you for most excellent service !

title: A most useful app
text:
Hands down one of my most used apps. There are different features, each started out as another cherry on top. Gboard being built in is fantastic, and it's a wonderful keyboard. Gboard has a dictation feature, the best gif swarch, integrated Google search built into the keyboard, and now one handed mode. The voice search and Google now features are wonderful and tires into personalized results with my Google account and the news stories often gives me useful articles that I actually read. 
This app lives in my dock and I use it serval times every day.

title: Bathtub overflowed and I was rescued
text:
I was getting ready to go on a week-long trip when my bathtub overflowed.  I called Restoration 1 OKC and they came right over to get things dried out.  I left for my trip and Trey came over while I was gone to finish drying, testing for moisture.  He was great about staying in communication with me until it was done. (Yes, they are bonded so I had no problem giving them access to my house).  They submitted all the photos and documentation to my insurance company for me, too.  

Now I just need to get things put back together.

title: freezes at least half the time it's not 3 out of 4 times.
text:
A friend of mine has decided she likes to use Google Voice to reach me for whatever reason for text. And easily half the time if not more, while I am writing a text, it simply freezes. And I lose everything that I've written. 

This has happened dozens of times in the last month I've lost track of the count. really need to look at this, occasionally I will have another app that will freeze but it's an anomaly. 

With GoogleVoice, it's freezing even sometimes it seems I open it up is a feature.

It's also antiquated compared to other messaging apps, the fact that you can't edit a typo before the messages read or you can't unsend a message is really also way under the bar compared to the other apps that I've taken over many peoples messaging choices.  I hope someday Google reads this actually tries to do something about it. It would be nice if it were fixed. I have a Google voice number, it's kind of important and useful for me. And the hundreds of millions of others who also have a Google voice number and use this app
